title: How was the 2020 flu season? - Quora

response.answer_text: CDC estimated that this year's flu season led to at least 18 million medical visits, 410,000 hospitalizations, and 24,000 deaths from Oct. 1, 2019 to April 4, 2020. In comparison, it was well below the 2018–2019 season which included an estimated 35.5 million people getting sick with influenza, 16.5 million people going to a health care provider for their illness, 490,600 hospitalizations, and 34,200 deaths. The 2019-2020 flu season, charted.

Covid19 is holding the FLU in abeyance. Although when it hits then it shall truly hit like a dam being ruptured and broken open. Your illiterate president likes to pretend he knows science. Others simply roll on the floor when his medical evaluation seeps out. Yes he did all of that. Yes he is the American god. Yes 350 million will likely die if his truth exists for too long. I await with unabated breath to hear the trump view of flu in the year 2020.
